src:
Un día después del debate
Sánchez insta a la movilización y pide a sus votantes que convenzan a indecisos
05 Nov 2019, 18:32 by La Información

El presidente en funciones ha asegurado que, tanto el partido de Casado como la formación de Rivera, "han unido su destino a la ultraderecha"

El presidente del Gobierno en funciones, Pedro Sánchez ha instado a su electorado a la movilización masiva para el próximo 10 de noviembre y ha transmitido a sus votantes la necesidad de "convencer" a los indecisos. Apenas unas horas después del debate electoral a cinco, el líder socialista ha reivindicado la tolerancia frente a quienes abogan por el bloqueo y reivindican una España "en blanco y negro", durante un mitin del partido que ha tenido lugar en el Palacio de Congresos de Badajoz.
El cabeza de lista del PSOE ha asegurado que, tanto el partido de Pablo Casado como el de Albert Rivera, "han unido su destino a la ultraderecha", a la que ha atribuido la voluntad de "suspender las autonomías, derogar la Ley de violencia de género e ilegalizar partidos políticos".
Por ello, ha incidido en la necesidad de acudir masivamente a la urnas para descongelar España: "Votar PSOE es votar Gobierno; el resto, con un montón de siglas a izquierda y derecha, solo quiere bloqueo".
Sánchez ha remarcado que el PSOE es el único partido que tiene un proyecto para España, "el único que quiere un Ejecutivo fuerte y estable", así como el que defiende un país avanzado en justicia social y convivencia y ha señalado que, frente a otras formaciones con pactos "ocultos", el Partido Socialista sigue únicamente ese objetivo.
text:
One day after the debate
Sánchez urges the mobilization and asks his voters to convince the undecided
05 Nov 2019, 18:32 by The Information

The acting president has assured that both the Casado party and Rivera's formation "have joined their destiny to the extreme right"

The acting President of the Government, Pedro Sánchez has urged his electorate to mass mobilization on November 10 and has transmitted to his voters the need to "convince" the undecided. Just a few hours after the five-year election debate, the socialist leader has claimed tolerance against those who advocate the blockade and claim a "black and white" Spain, during a meeting of the party that has taken place at the Congress Palace of Badajoz
The head of the PSOE list has ensured that both Pablo Casado and Albert Rivera's party "have joined their destiny to the extreme right", to which they have attributed the will to "suspend autonomy, repeal the Law of Violence gender and illegalize political parties. "
Therefore, it has influenced the need to go massively to the polls to unfreeze Spain: "Voting PSOE is voting for the Government; the rest, with a lot of acronyms left and right, just want blocking."
Sánchez has remarked that the PSOE is the only party that has a project for Spain, "the only one that wants a strong and stable executive", as well as the one that defends an advanced country in social justice and coexistence and has indicated that, compared to others formations with "hidden" pacts, the Socialist Party only follows that objective.
